jobs.title: Java Developer L1
jobs.description:
Key Responsibilities:
Develop, test, and maintain Java-based applications in accordance with established standards.

Translate software requirements into working and maintainable solutions.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams (including front-end developers, QA engineers, and DevOps) to define, design, and ship new features.

Participate in code reviews, mentor junior developers, and enforce coding standards and best practices.

Troubleshoot and resolve issues in existing software.

Write unit and integration tests to ensure software quality.

Optimize application performance, scalability, and reliability.

Continuously research and implement best practices, emerging technologies, and development tools.
requirements: Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
3+ years of professional experience in Java development.
Strong knowledge of Java (8 or later) and object-oriented programming principles.
Experience with frameworks like Spring, Spring Boot, Hibernate, or similar.
Proficiency in RESTful APIs, microservices architecture, and multithreading concepts.
Familiarity with relational databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle.
Working knowledge of version control tools (e.g., Git).
Understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban).
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Exposure to containerization tools like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI.
Experience with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Cassandra).
Familiarity with frontend technologies (Angular, React, or Vue.js) is a plus.
jobs.requirementsText:
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

3+ years of professional experience in Java development.

Strong knowledge of Java (8 or later) and object-oriented programming principles.

Experience with frameworks like Spring, Spring Boot, Hibernate, or similar.

Proficiency in RESTful APIs, microservices architecture, and multithreading concepts.

Familiarity with relational databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle.

Working knowledge of version control tools (e.g., Git).

Understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban).

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).

Exposure to containerization tools like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.

Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI.

Experience with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Cassandra).

Familiarity with frontend technologies (Angular, React, or Vue.js) is a plus.

jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.description: We are seeking a detail-oriented, organized, and strategic Project Manager to lead and coordinate projects from inception through to completion. The Project Manager will be responsible for planning, executing, and finalizing projects according to deadlines and within budget. This includes acquiring resources, coordinating efforts of team members, and ensuring project objectives are achieved.
requirements: Define project scope, goals, and deliverables in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders.
Develop detailed project plans, schedules, and work breakdown structures.
Coordinate internal resources and third-party vendors for the flawless execution of projects.
Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goals.
Manage changes to the project scope, schedule, and costs using appropriate verification techniques.
Identify and mitigate project risks and issues.
Ensure resource availability and allocation.
Report and escalate issues to management as needed.
Foster communication among project stakeholders and team members.
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, IT, Engineering, or a related field.
3+ years of proven experience in project management.
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent preferred.
Strong understanding of formal project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, etc.).
Proficient in project management software (e.g., MS Project, Jira, Asana, Trello).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong leadership, organizational, and time-management skills.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Skills:
Experience in [industry-specific experience, e.g., software development, construction, marketing, etc.].
Knowledge of budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting.
Conflict resolution and problem-solving skills.
Change management experience.
